programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani meet the volunteers trying to save the River Wye from pollution.

programme.title: Dragons' Den S20
programme.desc: Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett assess the profit-making potential of a fresh set of investment-hungry entrepreneurs. An Olympic athlete hopes for a podium finish for her figure-skating clothing brand, and a vacuum attachment to combat dust from drilling aims to suck in the Dragons' cash. A coffee company couple hope they won't be on the receiving end of a roasting for their pitch, and will a volunteering app have the Dragons offering up their services?

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Walks of Life (Edinburgh) S1 (6/8)
programme.desc: «Edinburgh»JB Gill searches for hidden gems amongst Edinburgh's more familiar tourist sites.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and the teams shop for treasures at Oswestry antiques fair in Shropshire, with experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper on hand to advise. Charlie challenges fairgoers to guess the purpose of an intriguing food-related mystery item.

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs S1 (2/2)
programme.desc: The team uncovers the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators.

programme.title: Lifeline (Marie Curie)
programme.desc: «Marie Curie»Jacqui Joseph appeals on behalf of Marie Curie, supporting people with terminal illnesses.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The big political issues of the day.

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the latest round of matches in rugby league's Super League. It's round six of the season and two of the early pace-setters are away from home. Warrington, who won their opening four matches in the competition, are away to Castleford, whilst Catalans Dragons, who are also unbeaten through the opening four rounds, travel to Leeds. Huddersfield Giants host defending champions St Helens, Wigan play Salford and Wakefield are at home to Hull KR. Newly promoted Leigh Leopards are hoping to continue their impressive start to life back in Super League when they travel to Hull FC.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: A new team of challengers take on probably the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers (Pies and Pasties) S4 (3/5)
programme.desc: «Pies and Pasties»The duo travel from Cornwall to Scotland, cooking pasties, pork pies and fish in pastry.

programme.title: Celebrity Painting Challenge S1 (2/4)
programme.desc: Six celebrities tackle landscapes with a digital vegscape and a stunning London skyline.

programme.title: My Unique B&B (Faith's Geodome) S2 (2/15)
programme.desc: «Faith's Geodome»Simon's team is in Devon to help Faith create a unique B&B as a tribute to her father.

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes (Norway) S2 (7/8)
programme.desc: «Norway»Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin head to Norway, where architecture is influenced by incredible landscapes and extreme climate.

programme.title: Flog It ! S17
programme.desc: Today Flog It! comes from the Blickling estate in north Norfolk. Five antiques experts are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. David Harper is excited by a Rolex oyster watch, and Paul Martin learns more about Lord Lothian, who inherited Blickling in 1930 and played a key role in getting America involved in the Second World War.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games decanter, or will they be tempted by the House of Games kitchen composter?

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival (Anstruther) S1 (12/20)
programme.desc: «Anstruther»Edith Bowman introduces Colin Murray to her home town of Anstruther on a food adventure.

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect S3
programme.desc: Mother and son remodel their London terrace after choosing a design using virtual reality.

programme.title: Great British Menu S18
programme.desc: It's national finals week on Great British Menu, where the winners from the regional heats compete to earn a place on the menu of a spectacular banquet celebrating animation and illustration for Paddington's 65th birthday. Each episode sees the eight rivals compete over a different course, from starter through to dessert, where they will be marked out of ten by an expert judging panel which, each episode, features a different well-known guest judge. This time, it's legendary animator and co-founder of Aardman animations, Peter Lord. The chefs cook their fish courses for him in a bid to secure a place on the menu at the banquet.

programme.title: 54 Days (Murder in Mayfair)
programme.desc: «Murder in Mayfair»Nawal Al-Maghafi seeks answers from the only suspect in Martine Magnussen's murder.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo S15
programme.desc: The magnificent Darren Harriott introduces Jessica Fostekew and Stephen Bailey to the famous Apollo stage. Other acts to appear throughout the series include Tom Allen, Rosie Jones, Kae Kurd, Sindhu Vee, Alex Edelman, Lou Sanders, Desiree Burch, Paul McCaffrey, Jonny Pelham, Ardal O'Hanlon, Sara Barron, Mawaan Rizwan, Guz Khan, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Rhys James, Sara Pascoe, Chris McCausland and Flo & Joan.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing up to China
programme.desc: How Taiwan's government and young people fight what they say is Chinese disinformation.

programme.title: Between the Covers S6 (3/6)
programme.desc: Sara is joined by Mel Giedroyc, Sophie Duker, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Nigel Havers.
